description: {"blocks":[{"key":"2s8fv","text":"This protocol describes live imaging of primary neuron cultures. Included are methods for preparing hippocampal or dopamine neuronal cultures from neonatal mouse brain tissue. The imaging described involves labeling of dopamine neurons with a fluorescent DAT ligand and using virally encoded pHlourin sensors to measure vesicular release of neurotransmitter as the neurons are electrically stimulated. This technique was used in Jain et al., 2023 to compare vesicular release in neurons between various transgenic knockout mouse lines.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"3s8so","text":"Collect mouse pups at postnatal day 0","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"41k0","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5pu2g","text":"Decapitate and remove brain, dissect out hippocampi from each hemisphere into Hank's balanced salt solution (HBSS) containing 10 mM HEPES and 20 mM glucose","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3ji8a","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f5us8","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bp056","text":"Triturate hippocampi to get a single cell suspension","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3bp2l","text":"Using a hemocytometer, count the density of cells in the suspension","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5ct72","text":"For Jain et al., 2023, cultures were prepared from WT, Î²3A KO, Î²3B KO, and mocha mice","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":75,"length":5}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"b8tmv","text":"Store cultures in incubator at   ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":31,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"1a8fv","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"37","unit":10}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3bk96","text":"Coat coverslips with poly-L-lysine and laminin; plate astrocyte monolayer onto coverslips","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"5pdjv","text":"Collect mouse pups at postnatal day 0","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bd6rm","text":"Decapitate and remove brain, dissect out midbrain (including ventral tegmental area and substantia nigra) from each hemisphere into Hank's balanced salt solution (HBSS) containing 10 mM HEPES and 20 mM glucose","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6nlc6","text":"Digest with papain (20 units/mL) in papain digestion buffer (HBSS with 20 mM CaCl2, 5 mM EDTA, 0.2 mg/mL L-Cysteine, 10 mM HEPES at pH 7.4) for 15 minutes","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":81,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"oemg","text":"Wash digested tissue three times with HBSS containing 10 mM HEPES and 20 mM glucose","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"dugft","text":"Triturate tissue to get a single cell suspension","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"54umu","text":"Using a hemocytometer, count the density of cells in the suspension","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8d8b4","text":"At DIV 2-4, infect with lentivirus","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8jjln","text":"For Jain et al., 2023, cells were infected with lentivirus encoding VMAT2-pH or VGLUT2-pH","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"36gtf","text":"Maintain cultures until ready for imaging. Live imaging of cultures is performed at DIV14-16 for hippocampal cultures and DIV13-15 for dopamine neuron cultures","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3j9td","text":"For midbrain cultures, label dopamine neurons, incubate dopamine neuron cultures in Tyrode's buffer (119 mM NaCl, 25 mM HEPES, 2 mM CaCl2, 2 mM MgCl2, 2.5 mM KCl, and 30 mM","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":136,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"c7gtq","text":"Make Tyrode's +JHC1-64 by adding the fluorescent DAT ligand JHC1-64 at 30 nM to Tyrode's buffer","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"33qja","text":"Incubate dopamine neuron culture in Tyrode's +JHC1-64 for 5 minutes at   ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":71,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"aet7l","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"","unit":32}}}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"889v8","text":"Rinse neurons in Tyrode's buffer (no JHC 1-64)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"f01e5","text":"Prepare Tyrode's buffer:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2irj1","text":"119 mM NaCl","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9flgv","text":"25 mM HEPES ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7lprb","text":"2 mM CaCl2","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":9,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"226kn","text":"2 mM MgCl2 ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":9,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d30j5","text":"2.5 mM KCl ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e51mq","text":"30 mM glucose","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"86v3r","text":"Adjust pH to 7.4","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7jgjr","text":"Add fresh Tyrode's buffer to culture dishes, mount coverslips in a perfusion and stimulation chamber of a TE300 inverted epifluorescence microscope","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"erjpd","text":"Monitor fluorescence: ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"71gtr","text":"For pHlourin, use 470/40 nm excitation and 525/70 nm emission bandpass filters","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6mpg3","text":"For JHC1-64, use 545/25 nm excitation and 605/70 nm emission bandpass filters","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"333t","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2h5a4","text":"Use the red channel to identify dopamine neurons then switch to the pHlourin channel for experiments","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3afk3","text":"Acquire images, typically at 1 Hz except for Fluo-5F imagine where images are acquired at 10 Hz","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"405r1","text":"Place platinum-iridium stimulating electrodes near the dopamine neuron being observed ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"36nht","text":"While acquiring images, evoke action potentials using 1 ms bipolar current pulses through the stimulating electrode at 5-10 V/cm","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
